msContents.summary: Three receipts for payment of twenty drachmas each from three brothers, Chairemon, Herakles(?) and Diodoros for poll tax. All have the same father, Chairemon; the mother of Herakles and Diodoros is Apia, Chairemon's mother being Diodora

msItemStruct.note: The hand is a rapid cursive

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: The 4th year of the Emperor Caesar Titus Aelius Hadrianus Antoninus Augustus Pius, the 16th of Pachon, calculated for Pharmouthi, Chairemon, son of Chairemon, also called Apollonios, whose mother is Diodora, paid on account of the poll-tax of the fourth year at the Syrian quarter twenty drachmas, totals 20; the surtax 10 obols in bronze. The 4th year of the Emperor Caesar Titus Aelius Hadrianus Antoninus Augustus Pius, the 16th of Pachon, calculated for Pharmouthi, Herakles, son of Chairemon, also called Chairemon, whose mother is Apia, paid on account of the poll-tax of the fourth year at the Syrian quarter twenty drachmas, totals 20; the surtax 10 obols in bronze. The 4th year of the Emperor Caesar Titus Aelius Hadrianus Antoninus Augustus Pius, the 16th of Pachon, calculated for Pharmouthi, Didodoros son of Chairemon, also [called Chairemon, whose mother is Ap]ia, paid on account of the poll-tax of the fourth year at the Syrian quarter twenty drachmas, totals 20; the surtax 10 obols in bronze.
